fullText: Ms. Nixon brings a brilliant specificity to her portrayal of Vivian Bearing, the English professor and John Donne scholar who is dying of ovarian cancer. She makes you feel the character's fierce intelligence even as that intelligence becomes a burden.
dtliExcerpt: Ms. Nixon brings a brilliant specificity to her portrayal of Vivian Bearing, the English professor and John Donne scholar who is dying of ovarian cancer. She makes you feel the character's fierce intelligence even as that intelligence becomes a burden.
bwwExcerpt: This is a performance that is large and lucid and delicate at the same time, and it justifies Manhattan Theater Club’s decision to mount what is essentially a chamber piece on Broadway. As directed with a persuasive combination of showmanship and sensitivity by Lynne Meadow, this production magnifies the innate theatricality of Ms. Edson’s play without compromising the firm emotional truth at its center.
